Typealiases.html#/s:10APIManager11HTTPHe.name: HTTPHeaders
Typealiases.html#/s:10APIManager11HTTPHe.abstract: HTTPHeaders are components of the header section of request and response messages in the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP). They define the operating parameters of an APIRequest.

Typealiases.html#/s:10APIManager14HTTPPa.name: HTTPParameters
Typealiases.html#/s:10APIManager14HTTPPa.abstract: HTTPParameters are set of querys used to access specific data via an APIRequest. These parameters will be postpended to a url in form ?key1=value1&key2=value... etc.

Typealiases.html#/s:10APIManager8HTTPBod.name: HTTPBody
Typealiases.html#/s:10APIManager8HTTPBod.abstract: JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) is a lightweight data-interchange format. Designed to be easy for humans to read and write and easy for machines to parse and generate.

Protocols/APIReturnable.html#/s:10APIMan.name: init(from:)
Protocols/APIReturnable.html#/s:10APIMan.abstract: Defines how to convert returned Data into an APIReturnable object

Protocols/APIService.html#/s:10APIManage.name: headers
Protocols/APIService.html#/s:10APIManage.abstract: The HTTPHeaders to be sent alongside the APIRequests made by the endpoints in this APIService.

Protocols/APIService.html#/s:10APIManage.name: validate(statusCode:)
Protocols/APIService.html#/s:10APIManage.abstract: Offers an optional point for an APIService to determine what HTTPReponse status codes are valid.

Protocols/APIAuthorization.html#/s:10API.name: embedInto(request:)
Protocols/APIAuthorization.html#/s:10API.abstract: Defines how to embed a custom APIAuthorization object into an APIRequest. This can be done by modifying the request’s one or all of the following: url parameters, body, headers

Protocols/APIAuthorization.html.name: APIAuthorization
Protocols/APIAuthorization.html.abstract: APIAuthorization defines all the properties and methods a class must contain to be used as an authorization for an APIRequest.

Protocols/APIService.html.name: APIService
Protocols/APIService.html.abstract: APIService defines all the properties and methods a class must contain to be used as a service in an APIRequest.

Protocols/APIReturnable.html.name: APIReturnable
Protocols/APIReturnable.html.abstract: Defines the methods required for an object to be returned by an APIService

Enums/APIRequestError.html#/s:10APIManag.name: invalidHTTPReponse
Enums/APIRequestError.html#/s:10APIManag.abstract: occurs when an APIRequest gets a response with an invalid response code, additionally provides a decription of the error code

Enums/APIRequestError.html#/s:10APIManag.name: internalError
Enums/APIRequestError.html#/s:10APIManag.abstract: occurs when an APIRequest encounters an inconsistancy it does not know how to handle, additionally provides a decription of the error

Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:10APIManager10H.name: GET
Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:10APIManager10H.abstract: The GET method requests a representation of the specified resource. Requests using GET should only retrieve data.

Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:10APIManager10H.name: HEAD
Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:10APIManager10H.abstract: The HEAD method asks for a response identical to that of a GET request, but without the response body.

Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:10APIManager10H.name: POST
Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:10APIManager10H.abstract: The POST method is used to submit an entity to the specified resource, often causing a change in state or side effects on the server.

Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:10APIManager10H.name: PUT
Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:10APIManager10H.abstract: The PUT method replaces all current representations of the target resource with the request payload.

Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:10APIManager10H.name: DELETE
Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:10APIManager10H.abstract: The DELETE method deletes the specified resource.

Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:10APIManager10H.name: OPTIONS
Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:10APIManager10H.abstract: The OPTIONS method is used to describe the communication options for the target resource.

Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:10APIManager10H.name: PATCH
Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:10APIManager10H.abstract: The PATCH method is used to apply partial modifications to a resource.

Enums/APIRequestError.html.name: APIRequestError
Enums/APIRequestError.html.abstract: Enumeration of the Errors that can occur during an APIRequest.

Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.name: Success
Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.abstract: Alias for the callback when an APIRequest succeeds, called with the json response.

Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.name: Failure
Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.abstract: Alias for the callback when a APIRequest fails, called with the error description.

Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.name: Cancellation
Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.abstract: Alias for the callback when an APIRequest is cancelled. No additional data is provided.

Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.name: endpoint
Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.abstract: The endpoint for the HTTP Request relative to the baseURL of the service.

Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.name: method
Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.abstract: The method for the HTTP Request.

Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.name: service
Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.abstract: TODO: Document

Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.name: params
Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.abstract: The url parameters for the HTTP Request.

Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.name: body
Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.abstract: The json body for the HTTP Request.

Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.name: authorization
Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.abstract: The object used to authorize the request.

Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.name: success
Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.abstract: The callback on a successful APIRequest, called with the an object of the ReturnType.

Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.name: failure
Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.abstract: The callback on a failed APIRequest, called with the error.

Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.name: cancellation
Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.abstract: The callback on a cancelled APIRequest.

Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.name: urlRequestCallback(data:response:error:)
Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.abstract: The callback for the URLRequest used to make the APIRequest

Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.name: urlRequest
Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.abstract: Converts the APIRequest into a URLRequest.

Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.name: dataTask
Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.abstract: Undocumented

Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.name: init(service:endpoint:params:body:method:)
Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.abstract: Creates a new APIRequest.

Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.name: deinit
Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.abstract: Undocumented

Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.name: onSuccess(_:)
Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.abstract: Sets the callback on a successful APIRequest, called with the an object of the ReturnType.

Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.name: onFailure(_:)
Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.abstract: Sets the callback on a failed APIRequest, called with the error.

Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.name: onCancellation(_:)
Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.abstract: Sets the callback on a cancelled APIRequest.

Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.name: authorization(_:)
Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.abstract: Sets the authorization for an APIRequest.

Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.name: perform()
Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:10APIManager1.abstract: Performs the APIRequest. On a successful request the success closure will be called with the an object of the ReturnType. On a failed request the failure closure will be called with the error. On a cancelled request the cancellation closure will be called.

Typealiases.html.name: Type Aliases
Typealiases.html.abstract: The following type aliases are available globally.
